title: 114_s2216
content: The "Senior$afe Act of 2015" may be cited as the short title. It provides immunity. The "Senior$afe Act of 2015" defines key terms such as "bank," "broker-dealer," "covered agency," and "covered financial institution." The "Senior$afe Act of 2015" defines key terms including "covered financial institution" as a bank, credit union, investment adviser, and broker-dealer. It also clarifies terms such as "credit union," "exploitation," "Federal financial institutions regulatory agencies," and "investment adviser." The "Senior$afe Act of 2015" provides immunity for individuals who have received training and disclose possible exploitation of a senior citizen to a covered agency in good faith and with reasonable care. The "Senior$afe Act of 2015" grants immunity to covered financial institutions if an employee discloses exploitation of a senior citizen after receiving training as described in section 3. The "Senior$afe Act of 2015" requires covered financial institutions to provide training on identifying and reporting senior citizen exploitation to relevant employees within 12 months of employment. SEC. 4. PREEMPTION. This Act does not override any State laws that offer equal or greater protection against liability for individuals or covered financial institutions.
